page.title: 20Hobbies in Adisham
page.content: Many people stated that home life, gardening, and looking after pets left little time for hobbies. Women are also engaged in dressmaking, sewing and knitting in practical ways for the home and creatively as a hobby. Tapestry, crochet, embroidery and doll making are also undertaken. Those families who support village activities helped with the organization of bazaars, jumble sales and other activities. Wives made craft items for sale and cooked goodies to be eaten or sold. They also helped other villagers in times of trouble or illness. A village magazine is pro- duced. Many families do not enter into any village activities. Music, creative writing, book production and many forms of art are followed. There is at least one professional artist and several talented amateurs. All homes had tele- vision but some preferred the radio.
